pages.title: Statements on the budgets of associations

elements.name: question1
rows: The Board of Directors always determines the amount of the membership fees.
The membership fees must always cover all of the association's costs.
Budgeting is generally based on the budget for the current year.
The sponsorship contributions are contributions from the state.
The Board of Directors always performs its duties without compensation.
In the long term, the association's income must be at least equal to its expenditure.
The budget is generally binding for the Board of Directors.
The budget is adjusted quarterly if necessary.
The actual figures are compared with the budget figures at the end of the year.
Many clubs improve their earnings situation by organizing events.
